Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
f9700 pin1 12.5 not holding steady.
r9788=12.5
r9782=12.5
r9789=12.2
pin 5 9707=.5
q9706 pin 4=12.5
q9707 pin 3=11.9
q9706 pin 3=12.17
PP3V_SO=3.2
I saw corrosion by pin 6 on 9707 and the pad near it relating to PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR
R2055=0.3

my guess is that i replace 9707 based on corrosion. I just don't know how to read properly is what I am thinking.
if anyone can help me where i am going wrong-
thanks in advance

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Well pin 5 on Q9707 should of course be high. Are you sure there is an image? Is SMC_LID high?

for sure image.
SMC_LID @R6961 pin2= 3.44

0.5512 diode mode
99.4Kohm

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: That is as it should be. Do a PRAM reset. Are you sure SMC_LID is high? Are you leaving the battery indicator disconnected?

lcd connector area was also heavily corroded earlier. I have not tried a known working lcd
SMC_LID=3.442

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Is the image still present after the PRAM reset?
Also I hope you are measuring pin 5 of Q9707 with an LCD plugged in, else there will be no voltage of course.

yes there is still image present after pram

threads.message:
40 what, Volts, milli volts? Please learn how to use a multimeter first. 
Also check R0910 it is common to corrode open.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: pin 1 of r0910 is fucked, i cant get solder to stick to it. the pad is gone but i made spot in track for new pad. cant get it to hold to pin 1 though.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: You measure resistance and not voltage when you check a resistor. Please go and learn some multimeter basics before we continue with this.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
.5477 pin 5 q9707 diode mode
resistance to gnd pin 5 9707 99.3kohm
pin 5 9707 3.34
c9020 12.18

I also made sure that everywhere I could find PPBUS_G3H is 12.24. I had to run a jumper from backlight fuse f9700 to pin 4 on q4262 to get that up
changed a bunch of stuff I saw that was corroded
changed lp8550 chip
tried different lcd and connector
reflowed the lcd connector
I am just not sure, should I give up on this one?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Voltage on R9715 and R9704? 
The 12.24V on PPBUS is also worrying because that means SMC is not talking to the ISL6259. You measured 12.5V on F9700 before so I wonder what happened there.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
0V Pin 2 R9715
0.14V both pin 1 and 2 R9704

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Do you get voltage at pin1 of R9731?
If not, R0910 is bad.
Check again exact voltage at F9700 too...
PWM missing from PCH, but there is a trick you can do to test backlight.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
I replaced R0910 and noticed R9704 smoking, so I changed R9716, C9704, R9704,R9714 and R9731 and I am still seeing smoke from R904.  this happen only when plugged in, with battery only it does not bubble and smoke
now I am nervous to put more power to take measurement of F9700

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: This is 3 months ago, I'm sorry but I'm not digging through this whole topic again.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Modder1, post: 15485"]I replaced R0910 and noticed R9704 smoking, so I changed R9716, C9704, R9704,R9714 and R9731 and I am still seeing smoke from R904. this happen only when plugged in, with battery only it does not bubble and smoke
now I am nervous to put more power to take measurement of F9700[/QUOTE]

A component smokes when more power is going through it than it is rated for by a significant amount. The only logical way for R9704 to smoke is if it is shorted to ground. The only way for it to short to ground is via U9701 or C9704. I would measure resistance to ground on both sides of R9704[I](NO POWER APPLIED DURING RESISTANCE MEASUREMENTS!). [/I]This is most likely you fucked up soldering something, or U9701 is bad. You didn't mention replacing U9701 after the smoking.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: If R9704 is really smoking something is VERY fucked. No way U9701 or U1800 can provide enough current to do so without them fucking up. So by now U1800 and U9701 are dead I'm sure.
